review.title: Dempster-Shafer Theory for Move Prediction in Start Kicking of The Bicycle Kick of Sepak Takraw Game
review.abstract: This paper presents Dempster-Shafer theory for move prediction in start kicking of the bicycle kick of sepak takraw game. Sepak takraw is a highly complex net-barrier kicking sport that involves dazzling displays of quick reflexes, acrobatic twists, turns and swerves of the agile human body movement. A Bicycle kick or Scissor kick is a physical move made by throwing the body up into the air, making a shearing movement with the legs to get one leg in front of the other without holding on to the ground. Specifically, this paper considers bicycle kick of sepak takraw game in start kicking of the ball with uncertainty where player has different awareness regarding the contingencies. We have chosen Dempster-Shafer theory because the advantages of the Dempster-Shafer theory which include the ability to model information in a flexible way without requiring a probability to be assigned to each element in a set, providing a convenient and simple mechanism for combining two or more pieces of evidence under certain conditions, it can model ignorance explicitly, rejection of the law of additivity for belief in disjoint propositions.
histories: Middle-East Journal of Scientific Research, Vol. 16, No. 7, 2013. ISSN 1990-9233, pp. 896 - 903
review.COMMENTS: Middle-East Journal of Scientific Research, Vol. 16, No. 7, 2013. ISSN 1990-9233, pp. 896 - 903

metadata.title: Dempster-Shafer Theory for Move Prediction in Start Kicking of The Bicycle Kick of Sepak Takraw Game

sections.text: Sepak takraw is a highly complex sport in which the body is flung into the air by fast reflexes, acrobatic twists, turns and deflections of the agile movement of the human body. A bicycle kick or scissor kick is a physical movement in which the body is thrown into the air, making a shearing motion with the legs to place one leg in front of the other without holding onto the ground. Specifically, this essay looks at the bicycle kick of the sepak takraw game in the initial kick of the ball with uncertainty, where the player has a different awareness of the eventualities. We chose the Dempster-Shafer theory because the advantages of the Dempster-Shafer theory include the ability to model information flexibly without requiring the probability to assign each element in a set, creating a convenient and simple mechanism to combine two or more pieces of evidence under certain conditions.

sections.heading: INTRODUCTION
sections.text: This year, it has reached the stage where it will be able to take the lead.

sections.heading: SEPAK TAKRAW GAME
sections.text: Sepak takraw is a skill ball game that requires the use of the feet and head to keep the ball in the air and in a targeted direction. Sepak takraw or kickvolleyball is a sport native to Southeast Asia that resembles volleyball except that it uses a rattan ball and only allows players to use their feet and head to touch the ball. A cross between football and volleyball, it is a popular sport in Thailand, Cambodia, Malaysia, Laos, the Philippines and Indonesia. Lately, the game has also become famous outside Asia, such as the United States, Canada, England, Germany, Brazil and New Zealand, where the game is played as a leisure activity and tournament. Garneplay briefly describes how to push a ball into the opposing court to reach a point.

sections.heading: DEMPSTER-SHAFER THEORY
sections.text: The Dempster-Shafer theory [7] or the theory of faith functions is a mathematical evidence theory that can be interpreted as a generalization of the probability theory, in which the elements of the sample space that are not attributed to the zero probability mass are not individual points, but propositions [8]. Propositions that do not obtain the zero mass are called focal elements. However, the sum of these probability masses is one, the fundamental difference between the Dempster-Shafer theory and the traditional probability theory is that the focal elements of a Dempster-Shafer structure may overlap. Dempster-Shafer theory also provides methods to represent and combine weights of evidence.

sections.heading: IMPLEMENTATION
sections.text: As shown in Figure 2, we describe ten movements, including movements with the left foot forward, movements with the right foot forward, movements with the right hand forward, movements with the left hand forward, movements with the left foot to the left, movements with the left foot to the right, movements with the right foot to the right, movements with the left foot backwards and movements with the right foot backwards. The strategy followed in the Dempster-Shafer theory for dealing with uncertainty roughly amounts to the beginning of a series of hypotheses.

The highest bpa value is m17 (B), which is equivalent to 0.92. This means the possibility of a movement of ten movements: left foot forward, right foot forward, right foot forward, right hand forward, left hand forward, left foot to the left, right foot to the left, right foot to the right, left foot to the back, right foot to the back and right foot to the back.

sections.heading: CONCLUSION
sections.text: We have proposed the Dempster-Shafer theory for predicting train movements when starting the Sepak Takraw bicycle ride. In this work we describe ten movements, including movements with the left foot forward, movements with the right foot forward, movements with the right foot forward, movements with the right hand forward, movements with the left hand forward, movements with the left foot to the left, movements with the left foot to the right, movements with the right foot to the right, movements with the left foot backward and movements with the right foot backward. The simplest method for quantifying uncertainty in a database is to assign a probability to each member of a relationship and to use these values to determine the probability that a particular value is the correct answer to a particular query. Knowledge in the collection of basic events is uncertain and can be used directly in simple cases to draw conclusions, but in many cases the various related events.

referenceMentions.context: Some research related with human movement have been developed which were prediction of the movement patterns for human squat jumping using the inverse-inverse dynamics technique [2] and neural network for human arm movement prediction in CVEs [3].

Some research related with human movement have been developed which were prediction of the movement patterns for human squat jumping using the inverse-inverse dynamics technique [2] and neural network for human arm movement prediction in CVEs [3].
In other words, the joint angles of the musculoskeletal model are found using optimization and the forces or moments needed for motion are calculated using inverse dynamics [2].
The results show many different combinations of back propagation neural network topologies are capable of predicting up to 400 ms of human arm movements relatively accurately [3].
[4] investigate the problem of learning to predict moves in the board game of Go from game records of expert players.

Monte Carlo search, and specifically the Upper Confidence Bounds applied to Trees algorithm, has contributed to a significant improvement in the game of Go and has received considerable attention in other applications [5], this article investigates two enhancements to the Upper Confidence Bounds applied to Trees algorithm.

The Dempster-Shafer theory [7] or the theory of belief functions is a mathematical theory of evidence which can be interpreted as a generalization of probability theory in which the elements of the sample space to which nonzero probability mass is attributed are not single points but sets [8].
